Ad Text:
Full Time/Permanent opportunity

$149,833 -¬† $167,903 per annum plus superannuation

Caring for our city, creating a future for all

Our people are passionate about their communities and connected to their teams. They‚Äôre motivated by our genuine commitment to diversity and inclusion, and our clear, compelling plan for our global city:‚ÄØSustainable Sydney 2030 ‚Äì 2050 Continuing the Vision.¬†

Be part of a purpose-led organisation with care at its core. You‚Äôll make a difference by acting in the best interests of our communities and city. Be better together with collaborative and inclusive partnerships. Embrace possibilities and be open to new ideas and creating bold solutions.¬†

About the role

The City is seeking a Resource Performance and Data Analyst, delivering performance management and digital transformation initiatives to enhance efficiency and effectiveness across the City Cleansing and Resource Recovery Unit. This role focuses on optimising services, systems, and data to drive operational performance in a constantly evolving compliance and digital landscape. The role is responsible for overseeing data management and performance.

Key Responsibilities:

lead and implement data led initiatives to enhance service delivery

develop and optimise processes, systems, and support training in digital literacy

drive continuous improvement, collaborating with managers and teams to identify and implement innovative solutions

lead projects focused on service transformation, digital capability, and improved performance outcomes.

We‚Äôre looking for someone with:

degree in data science or similar, or extensive experience in data administration and performance management

proven success in delivering strategic programs, business transformation, and continuous improvement

demonstrated experience in IT system implementation, budget management, and performance optimisation

strong leadership skills with the ability to drive cultural and operational change in a complex environment.

If you‚Äôre passionate about business transformation and service optimisation, apply today!

Please note: To be eligible for permanent appointment to this position, you must have Australian citizenship or hold permanent residency status with unrestricted working rights.¬†

Download position description.

This role has the option of a rostered day off each month, known as a 19-day month.¬†

The recommended applicant must complete a pre-employment health declaration form and a criminal history check.

Applications must be submitted online¬†by 11:59pm, Wednesday 4th March.

For further information,¬†contact Andrew O‚ÄôNeill ‚Äì Manager Performance & Compliance on 02 9265 9315.

What we can offer you

Part-time and job-sharing options available

Supportive return-to-work environment

Inclusive culture

Recognised as an Inclusive Employer by the Diversity Council of Australia

Active employee networks including City Women, City Pride, DiverseCity, Inclusive City, Young Professionals and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander network

Recognised family inclusive workplace

Veteran employment supporter

Find out why a career at the City of Sydney might be right for you.

How to apply

We welcome candidates from all backgrounds in a workplace as diverse as our communities. We‚Äôre passionate about gender balance, with an executive team two-thirds female and half of leadership roles held by women.¬†

All applicants, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disability, veterans and people of diverse sexualities and genders, are encouraged to join us.¬†

We‚Äôre a disability confident recruiter. If you identify as a person with disability and require support for your application or the recruitment process, contact us at ‚ÄØrecruitment@cityofsydney.nsw.gov.au‚ÄØor 02 9265 9333.¬†

Select ‚Äòapply now‚Äô to submit your resume and selection criteria.

FP&A Analyst
$120-150K + Super, Permanent
Melbourne Southeast
Are you looking for a rewarding FP&A role at a growing, recently acquired healthcare company?
We are working on behalf of an Australian corporation in the bayside area. They employ approximately 1500 staff and operate across Victoria.
This role will cover financial planning, reporting, budgeting and decision making within the finance function. This is an opportunity to work alongside the CFO and execute a three (3) year growth plan, to drive performance and deliver valuable insights into acquisitions and the post integration performance. The duties to be taken over are as follows:
¬†
Key Responsibilities
Assist in the annual budgeting and quarterly forecasting processes, incorporating industry standard pricing frameworks and participant funding models.
Develop long-term financial models (3-5 years) aligned with the industry market growth projections and regulatory changes.
Drive and implement cost improvement projects (CIP), continuously identifying and executing cost reduction opportunities in line with company P&L objectives.
Provide scenario analysis for service expansion, new support categories, and pricing changes under regulatory body guidelines.
Monitor Cash flow and working capital, particularly claim processing and payment cycles.
Analyse cost structures including support worker wages, travel time, and administrative overhead.
Help with decision making assisting the FC and CFO forge a lasting growth plan for the business.

You will have,¬†advanced systems, communication and presentation skills and have a genuine ambition to assist a team in transition and deliver stability.
Proven experience in Financial Planning and Analysis.
Strong understanding of IFRS standards and must have a CPA/CA or nearing completion.
Experience working with ERP, data modelling, or financial management systems.
Excellent stakeholder (internal & external) engagement and communication skills.

DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is a leading enterprise technology and innovation partner delivering software, services, and solutions to global enterprises and public sector organizations ‚Äî helping them harness AI to drive outcomes at a time of exponential change with speed. With deep expertise in Managed Infrastructure Services, Application Modernization, and Industry-Specific Software Solutions, DXC modernizes, secures, and operates some of the world‚Äôs most complex technology estates. Learn more on dxc.com




The Portfolio Performance & Insights Lead plays a critical role across a national self-insured workers‚Äô compensation program spanning all Australian jurisdictions. This role sits at the intersection of business performance, analytics, and technology enablement.¬†


This role is a hands-on performance leader responsible for personally designing, building, and delivering high-quality portfolio performance reporting and insights across a national, multi-jurisdiction self-insured workers‚Äô compensation program. This role will enable insight-led decision-making, translation of business needs into analytics requirements, and delivery through technology platforms The Lead will work closely with DXC and customer leadership to shape priorities, while directly producing the reports, dashboards, and insights that drive financial performance, operational consistency, and improved injured worker outcomes.¬†

Location for this role is flexible. Successful candidate can be based in any major city in Australia.


Key Responsibilities¬†

Reporting & Insight Delivery (Primary Accountability)¬†

Strategic owner of performance insights¬†

Design, build, and deliver national portfolio performance reports, dashboards, and insight packs for DXC and customer governance forums.¬†

Develop consolidated national views while appropriately reflecting jurisdictional differences across Australian workers‚Äô compensation schemes.¬†

Produce clear, accurate, and timely reporting covering key financial and operational drivers including claims cost, duration, medical and treatment spend, weekly benefits, common law exposure, recoveries, reserves, and return-to-work outcomes.¬†

Ensure all reporting is decision-ready, insight-led, and aligned to customer and DXC priorities.¬†

Define and lead the performance analytics and insights agenda aligned to organisational strategy, scheme sustainability, and regulatory obligations.¬†

Identify priority insight domains across claims performance, injury management outcomes, employer behaviour, financial performance/ sustainability, and risk exposure.¬†


Financial & Portfolio Analysis¬†

Undertake detailed analysis of portfolio performance to identify trends, risks, and opportunities across jurisdictions.¬†

Translate analysis into clear, actionable insights and recommendations that support financial sustainability and improved outcomes.¬†

Support forecasting, reserve monitoring, and performance tracking against budget and actuarial expectations, with a strong focus on explaining drivers and impacts.¬†

Performance Leadership & Stakeholder Partnership¬†

Partner with DXC and customer leadership teams to understand strategic priorities and ensure reporting directly supports decision-making.¬†

Lead performance conversations by presenting and explaining insights, not just producing data.¬†

Support customer governance forums, quarterly reviews, and ad-hoc performance deep dives.¬†

SME Engagement¬†

Work with subject matter experts across claims, injury management, finance and data teams to inform analysis.¬†

Clearly define analytical questions and data requirements, while retaining ownership for building and delivering the final outputs.¬†

Validate and challenge inputs from SMEs to ensure accuracy, relevance, and consistency.¬†

Continuous Improvement & Reporting Excellence¬†

Continuously improve reporting quality, automation, and efficiency across the national program.¬†

Build and maintain robust reporting frameworks, KPIs, and data definitions.¬†

Identify opportunities to reduce manual effort while increasing insight quality and consistency.¬†

Act as a technical reference point for portfolio performance reporting within the program.¬†




Skills, Experience & Capabilities¬†

Experience¬†

Strong hands-on experience in workers‚Äô compensation, self-insurance, insurance analytics, or portfolio performance reporting within the Australian market.¬†

Demonstrated experience building and delivering executive-level reports and dashboards, not just overseeing others.¬†

Experience working across multiple Australian jurisdictions and schemes in a national program context.¬†

Accountable for insight adoption and value realisation.¬†

Technical & Analytical Capability (Critical)¬†

Primary translator between business needs and analytics capability.¬†

Business lead for analytics technology enablement.¬†

Advanced capability in data analysis and report production using tools such as Power BI, Excel (advanced), SQL or similar.¬†

Strong understanding of workers‚Äô compensation financial and operational performance drivers.¬†

Ability to interpret, explain, and challenge complex data and actuarial outputs.¬†

High attention to detail with strong data integrity and quality focus.¬†

Communication & Influence¬†

Ability to clearly explain complex performance insights to senior stakeholders.¬†

Confident presenter who can lead performance discussions using facts and evidence.¬†

Strong written communication skills with a focus on concise, executive-ready outputs.¬†

Client-focused, outcome-driven, and execution-oriented.¬†

Comfortable operating as a hands-on contributor in a complex environment.¬†

Pragmatic, disciplined, and committed to delivering high-quality outputs.

The Opportunity
This is a time-critical Business Analyst contract supporting a university timetabling platform replacement (Celcat replacement) within a broader digital program. Procurement is complete, the new vendor platform is selected, and delivery risk is now sitting squarely in requirements quality, stakeholder alignment, and UAT readiness. They need a senior BA who can land, diagnose complexity fast, and drive clarity at pace to protect delivery timeframes and adoption.


About the Role

You will own end-to-end business analysis across timetabling and scheduling, from discovery through implementation-ready requirements and into UAT support, working across business, academic, vendor, and ICT delivery teams.

Lead requirements elicitation, analysis, validation, and sign-off (workshops, interviews, artefacts)

Map as-is and to-be timetabling and scheduling processes, including dependencies and impacts

Translate needs into functional and non-functional requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria

Partner with the vendor and delivery teams on solution alignment, options, and trade-offs

Actively manage scope, assumptions, dependencies, and requirements risk to prevent rework

Support UAT end to end: test approach, test cases, execution support, defect triage, validation



About You

You are not a generalist BA. You are senior, self-directed, and calm under delivery pressure, with the credibility to influence academic and operational stakeholders and the discipline to produce requirements that reduce downstream churn.

Proven senior or lead BA experience on complex enterprise programs with tight timelines

Strong requirements craft: process modelling, use cases, stories, and traceable acceptance criteria

Confident stakeholder management across senior business, academics, ICT, and vendors

Experience in complex environments (higher ed desirable, but regulated enterprise is fine)

Strong testing and UAT capability, including business-focused test design and defect triage

Timetabling, scheduling, or student lifecycle systems experience is highly desirable


The Benefits

Initial 6 month contract with strong scope for extension
Be a critical part of this delivery
Competitive Daily rate



How to Apply
Please apply with current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Nina Magill on nina.magill@davidsonwp.com, quoting reference JN -022026-42517. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

Ad Text:
The role



Manager, Digital Products & Applications leads a team of 10 digital and technology specialists (including business analysts, application support specialists and system engineers) responsible for the day‚Äëto‚Äëday operational management, support and continuous improvement of APRA's systems and digital applications.

This role has a strong operational focus, ensuring digital products and business applications are reliable, secure, well‚Äësupported and continuously enhanced to meet evolving business needs. effective incident and request management, prioritisation of enhancements, and embedding practices that improve service quality, stability and user experience.

As a people leader, you will build and lead a high‚Äëperforming team that responds to support requests, resolves issues efficiently, and proactively identifies opportunities to improve systems, automate processes and reduce operational risk. You will also play a key role in driving training, adoption and effective use of technology, supporting the digitisation and optimisation of business processes across the organisation.



The team



APRA's Technology team delivers, maintains, and enhances essential information technology services that support the organisation's productivity, strategic objectives, and business unit priorities.

Technology partner with stakeholders to design, implement and maintain IT solutions that meet the needs of the organisation and ensuring these are secure and aligned with APRA's technology architecture.



Key responsibilities



Lead, coach and develop a multi‚Äëdisciplinary team of 10 specialists, fostering a strong service culture focused on operational excellence and continuous improvement.
Own the operational run of digital products and business applications, ensuring systems are stable, secure, supported and fit for purpose.
Oversee incident, problem and request management, ensuring timely resolution, clear communication and minimal disruption to business operations.
Drive continuous improvement of systems and services by identifying enhancement opportunities, prioritising work, and reducing manual effort and technical debt.
Ensure effective training, adoption and use of digital tools, working with stakeholders to uplift digital capability and embed new ways of working.
Partner with business areas to digitise and optimise business processes, leveraging technology to improve efficiency, consistency and user experience.
Manage application lifecycle activities including upgrades, patching, configuration, and vendor support arrangements.
Ensure systems meet organisational security, risk and compliance requirements.
Plan and manage team capacity, work priorities and operational demand to deliver reliable outcomes.
Collaborate with senior stakeholders across APRA to align operational services with business priorities and technology strategy.





To work with us, you must be an Australian citizen with eligibility to gain a defence clearance through the Australian Government Security Vetting Agency.



About you



Proven experience in managing and leading high-performing cross-functional teams.
Demonstrable experience in the delivery of digital initiatives across multiple business domains.
Deep understanding of digital product management practices and human-centred design.
Experience in web platforms, cloud-based services, AI, Microsoft technologies, Oracle Cloud Fusion and integrated enterprise digital products.
Ability to manage priorities, resolve complex issues and drive outcomes in an agile, business-focused, collaborative environment.
Strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence senior leaders across all divisions.
Demonstrates strategic thinking, adaptability, and APRA-wide mindset, especially in navigating uncertainty and change.
Ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organisation.





About APRA

Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) was established in 1998 as an independent statutory authority that supervises almost 1,200 financial institutions that manage $8.6 trillion in assets for Australians across the banking, insurance and superannuation sectors.

In overseeing the safety, competitiveness and stability of the financial system, we seek to recruit, develop and retain highly skilled professionals, who want to help shape financial services and protect the financial wellbeing of the Australian community. Our employee base of almost 900 come predominantly from the commercial financial services industry or other government agencies; as such, we have the feel of a small corporate organisation that can work flexibly and with agility.

At APRA, we're committed to providing an inclusive workplace where everyone belongs, feels valued and respected. We aspire to attract and foster diversity of background, thought, and experience, recognising that a broad range of perspectives, approaches and ideas makes us stronger, and better enables us to meet our obligation to protect the financial wellbeing of the Australian community. If you need any adjustments during the recruitment process, please inform at application stage so we can do our best to accommodate your requirements.

About APRA

Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) was established in 1998 as an independent statutory authority that supervises almost 1,200 financial institutions that manage $8.6 trillion in assets for Australians across the banking, insurance and superannuation sectors.

In overseeing the safety, competitiveness and stability of the financial system, we seek to recruit, develop and retain highly skilled professionals, who want to help shape financial services and protect the financial wellbeing of the Australian community. Our employee base of almost 900 come predominantly from the commercial financial services industry or other government agencies; as such, we have the feel of a small corporate organisation that can work flexibly and with agility.

At APRA, we're committed to providing an inclusive workplace where everyone belongs, feels valued and respected. We aspire to attract and foster diversity of background, thought, and experience, recognising that a broad range of perspectives, approaches and ideas makes us stronger, and better enables us to meet our obligation to protect the financial wellbeing of the Australian community. If you need any adjustments during the recruitment process, please inform at application stage so we can do our best to accommodate your requirements.

The Company

Robert Half Technology are working with a privately owned Australian business that provides large-scale operational and support services to organisations with complex, multi-site environments. With a strong emphasis on people, process and technology, the organisation is known for tailoring solutions to client needs, managing dispersed teams, and delivering consistent service standards across diverse portfolios nationally.


The Role

We're looking for a commercially savvy Power BI Consultant to lead the evolution of our enterprise reporting and analytics capability.

Reporting to the CIO, you'll partner with senior stakeholders across operations and finance to design scalable Power BI solutions that turn complex data into clear, decision-driving insight.

This isn't just dashboard development, it's about understanding the why behind the data, shaping robust models, and delivering reporting that directly improves commercial and operational performance within a contract-driven business.


Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and optimise Power BI dashboards, data models, and reporting frameworks that drive operational and financial performance.
Translate complex business requirements into scalable Power BI solutions, including semantic models, DAX measures, and automated reporting pipelines.
Partner with senior stakeholders to identify commercial drivers and build insight solutions aligned to strategic priorities.
Perform advanced data analysis, root-cause investigations, and performance trend analysis to support executive decision-making.
Integrate multiple data sources (ERP, CRM, workforce systems, financial platforms) into cohesive reporting views.
Collaborate closely with Finance to ensure reporting aligns with P&L structures, budgets, forecasting models, and KPI frameworks.


Your Profile

5+ years' experience delivering Power BI solutions in a commercial, operational, or enterprise environment.
Strong expertise in:
Data modelling (star schema, relationships, optimisation)
DAX and advanced measure development
Power Query / data transformation
Building scalable semantic models
Experience working with data warehouses and enterprise reporting environments.
Strong understanding of commercial reporting, operational performance metrics, and financial frameworks.
Proven ability to translate ambiguous business problems into structured data solutions.
Strong stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to influence at senior levels.

We are looking for a high caliber Senior Business Analyst to join our client's dynamic delivery team. This is a pivotal role sitting at the intersection of regulatory interpretation, network operations, and digital delivery. You will be instrumental in translating complex regulatory obligations such as Flexible Exports (FEL) and Ministerial Orders into seamless business processes and auditable requirements.

As part of an established BA cohort, you will work on high profile initiatives (including FTA and Consumer Energy Resources) that ensure our network remains compliant, efficient, and customer-focused.

The Role

This isn't just about "gathering requirements." You will be a bridge between the regulator and the real world. You will work across discovery, policy design, and end to end delivery to ensure traceability from legislative intent through to implemented digital outcomes.

Key focus areas include:

Regulatory Translation: Distilling AER guidance, license conditions, and Ministerial Orders into clear, testable business requirements.
Process Engineering: Leading future state BPMN modelling across customer connections, network operations, and compliance workflows.
Digital Integration: Defining requirements for customer-facing portals and operational systems.
Collaborative Synthesis: Facilitating workshops with technical, digital, and regulatory stakeholders to turn ambiguous problems into structured solutions.
Governance & Documentation: Producing executive-quality BA artefacts and business cases suitable for audit-sensitive, regulated environments.

Requirements/Skillset:

Energy Domain Expertise: Deep experience in energy utilities or a similarly asset-intensive, highly regulated sector is essential.
Regulatory Savvy: Proven ability to work with evolving obligations and transform them into auditable delivery artefacts.
Methodological Discipline: Advanced skills in BPMN 2.0, structured discovery, and waterfall delivery environments.
Strategic Thinking: Experience developing options analyses and business cases to secure executive funding.
Communication: The ability to simplify complex technical or regulatory concepts for diverse audiences, from engineers to senior leaders.
7+ years of Business Analysis experience within complex or regulated organisations.
Tertiary qualifications in Business, Finance, Information Systems, or a related field.
A strong understanding of CER/DER concepts or electricity network operations.
Proficiency in tools such as Jira, Confluence, and MS Office.

At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Join the change. Electrify your future!

We've been proudly Aussie since 1837, always finding new ways to innovate in energy and essential services. Now, we're moving towards a sustainable future through electrification and investing in renewable energy-and we'd like you to join us. Whether you're on-site, in the office, or somewhere in between, you'll find opportunities to grow your career here. You'll work with a team that's passionate about powering Australian lives, in a culture that values inclusivity, respect, and learning. Help us create a cleaner energy future, and we'll back you every step of the way as you build your career.


About the role

An exciting new opportunity has become available to join our Integrated Portfolio Planning division. As the Manager - Market Modelling, you will lead the development and delivery of AGL's market modelling capability to provide robust, data-driven insights into electricity, gas and environmental markets. This role ensures accurate price forecasts, scenario analysis and modelling frameworks that inform trading strategies, portfolio optimisation and long-term planning.

What you'll be doing

Develop and maintain short and long-term market models for the national electricity (NEM) and gas markets.
Produce price and volatility forecasts to inform trading, hedging and asset planning.
Enhance modelling methodologies and tools, champion automation and data integrity.
Provide scenario analysis and sensitivities for strategic planning and investment cases.
Manage and develop a team of analysts; build technical capability and succession
readiness.
Foster collaboration across broader IPP teams for integrated portfolio insights.


About You

You are an established leader or a senior professional in the energy industry ready to take the next career step. You will ideally have qualifications a quantitative discipline and relevant experience in energy trading. Your expertise in energy market modelling & forecasting will set you up for success in this role.

In addition to the above, you will have

Advanced quantitative and analytical skills; proficiency in modelling tools and statistical
software.
Deep understanding of NEM operations, gas markets and environmental product schemes is desirable.
Ability to translate modelling outputs into actionable strategies.
Excellent communication skills to simplify complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Collaborative mindset with ability to work across functions.



Inclusion at AGL

At AGL, we value diversity and welcome applicants from various backgrounds, including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, individuals with disabilities, culturally diverse individuals, and members of the LGBTQ+ community. The role

You‚Äôll join a growing data capability on a modern stack, partnering with analysts and business teams to deliver consistent metrics, governed datasets, and robust pipelines. There‚Äôs also an exciting opportunity to build experience in Salesforce CRM Analytics (CRMA) ‚Äî ideal if you‚Äôre curious and keen to expand your toolkit.

What you‚Äôll be doing

Designing, building and governing scalable dbt + Snowflake models that power reporting and analytics

Integrating data from Salesforce, finance and operational systems into unified, analytics-ready datasets

Embedding consistent business logic and metric definitions (helping shape a semantic layer)

Implementing strong data quality controls (testing, monitoring freshness, pipeline health, schema changes)

Coaching and supporting analysts with best-practice modelling and dashboard development patterns

What you‚Äôll bring

Strong hands-on experience with Snowflake, dbt and SQL

Experience with Fivetran (or similar ELT/ETL tooling) and solid engineering habits (docs, version control, lineage)

Confidence translating stakeholder needs into well-designed data solutions

A proactive, curious mindset ‚Äî you enjoy improving how things work, not just keeping the lights on

Nice to have (and you‚Äôll be supported to learn)

Salesforce CRM Analytics (CRMA / Einstein Analytics) dashboard development and maintenance

Einstein Discovery or similar predictive modelling tooling

Experience in financial services or complex, regulated environments

We are currently partnering with a QLD Govt Dept to source an experienced Principal Analyst, Business Architecture who will be responsible for strategy development and ideation prioritisation, as well as building the enterprise capability around operating model management. This includes designing and leading the implementation of business architecture to support strategic objectives of reform activity.

In this role you will:

Develop processes for collating ideas and initiatives, shaping them into suitable packages of delivery and ensuring alignment to strategic and operational priorities

Manage the testing of prioritised initiatives against the investment framework

Design and implement the continuous improvement processes for transformation activities and facilitate embedding these processes into business as usual.

Support current and future capability model and associated integration of technical, process and people capabilities, particularly with respect to developing and maintaining key enterprise and strategic models, including target operating model, future state capability and outcome blueprint.

Lead and progress the development of the future operating model for the Transformation Office.

Scope, design and deliver projects as part of the reform agenda

Provide subject matter input, analysis and advice into all projects and change management activities, including systems replacement and future enterprise solutions.

Ensure alignment of strategic priorities of the reform agenda with capabilities, end-to-end value delivery, and organisational structure

Work with the Manager to support leaders across the organisation to prepare and equip the business for reform, and facilitate the integration into business

Support and manage implementation of systems and processes to ensure reporting requirements and deadlines for the Transformation Office are clearly defined and met.

Take an active role in communicating the Reform agenda for stakeholders

The essential requirements for this role are:

Consulting experience (internal consultancy), ideally in a complex, industrially sensitive operating environment.

Ability to assess, manage, and propose solutions for complex issues to enable the achievement of the reform agenda.

Experience in supporting large-scale reform or transformational change within an organisation

Experience in writing and reviewing technical documentation, able to contribute to the development of procedures, methodologies, standards, templates and policy documentation.

Understanding of all the elements of project management including change management and business integration processes and strategies.

This is an initial contract until the end of September with extension possible. There is flexibility to WFH however you must be based in Brisbane to attend the CBD Office 3 days per week.

Who are we?

Liontown Limited is an emerging leader in Australia's battery minerals sector. Following our recent capital raise, we are in a strong position as we transition into full production ramp-up at our flagship Kathleen Valley Lithium Operation. With a 20+ -year mine life, state-of-the-art processing facilities, and a passionate team, this is a rare opportunity to join a business that is building a globally significant lithium operation.

The Opportunity

This role of the Senior Business Analyst is critical in supporting the company's financial planning processes, including annual budgeting, periodic forecasting, and strategic business analysis. This is a full-time, permanent role, accountable for maintaining the Consolidation and Asset financial models and supports the evaluation of major investment opportunities. Based in our West Perth office, the Senior Analyst will work collaboratively with stakeholders across the organisation to deliver high-quality financial insights that drive decision-making and business performance.

What you'll be doing

Develop and maintain the Consolidation and Asset financial models covering mine plans, cost structures and financials.
Lead the Group's financial planning processes (including budget and forecast activities) by coordinating and consolidating inputs from the operations, commercial, and technical services teams for financial models.
Partner with cross-functional teams to identify and assess value‚Äëcreation and major investment opportunities through financial analysis.
Deliver accurate, timely, and insightful monthly and quarterly variance analysis supported by commentary.
Drive continuous improvement to enhance the financial modelling process through automation and integration with planning systems.

What we're looking for

Tertiary qualifications in commerce (finance and accounting).
Post graduate financial qualifications (CA or CPA).
Expert financial modelling skills in Excel.
Demonstrated experience in building complex 3-way financial models.
Ability to turn complex analysis into clear recommendations.
Stakeholder engagement and relationship building skills.
Mining and/or processing industry experience, particularly lithium, is advantageous but not essential.

Why Liontown

At Liontown, you'll be joining a company that's helping drive the clean energy future. Our operations are designed with sustainability at their core ‚Äî powered by renewables and built for long-term impact.

Visit: liontown.com to learn more.

Apply now and help shape what we build next.

Finance Manager - Strategic & Capital Insights¬†




Lead a high-performing team in 360 Finance to prepare, analyse, and communicate key business insights across AU-Retail and Big W.
FTC opportunity till end of June 2026
Norwest based based with hybrid work arrangements




We are Woolworths Group




We are Woolworths Group. 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives connected by a shared Purpose ‚Äì ‚Äòto create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.‚Äô It‚Äôs that Purpose that fuels our ambition to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week.¬†




If you‚Äôre excited to turn today‚Äôs blue sky thinking into a better tomorrow for future generations, you‚Äôll find yourself supported and enriched in a dynamic, inclusive and empowering workplace that reflects the diverse communities we serve. With a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and opportunities across the group to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.




Welcome to the Finance Team




We believe that the Woolworths Finance team is a high performing, innovative and diverse team across Australia and New Zealand, and is an amazing place to advance your career.¬†




Our teams work in a flexible work environment, including working from home 2 days per week. We are committed to flexibility and believe that it should be mutually beneficial.¬†




The Opportunity




As the Finance Manager for Strategic & Capital Insights, you will serve as a key advisor to the business, driving performance by analysing investment drivers to optimize return on investment of some of our Core capital programs. You will lead a team of three to deliver comprehensive analytics on New, Renewal, and eCom store programs and format proof of concepts, ensuring large-scale capital investments deliver their intended value. The role has oversight and accountability for the management, maintenance and integrity of all databases utilised by 360 Finance for performance insights and reporting and will act as the primary systems lead for 360 Finance for the FST program.¬†




What you'll do




Build influential relationships with business leads to identify, quantify, and strategise value-creation opportunities.
Deliver accurate analysis and recommendations on investments, including forecasting benefits for format proof of concepts, leading post-implementation reviews (PIRs) of investments within the Core programs ¬†to ensure benefits are realised.
Drive regular performance reviews to resolve inefficiencies, highlight opportunities, and improve return on investment reporting, including preparing the Quarterly Business Review pack and annual Board paper submission (May).
Contribute to the annual operating plan, ensuring store-level budgets align with the broader strategic vision and benefits expected from investments .
Develop lean operating models and embed internal controls to ensure adherence to financial protocols.
Lead the team in delivering financial insights through scenario modeling and data analytics to validate long-term targets and business cases.
Collaborate across departments including Property, Retail, and E-com to implement best practices and consistent ways of working.




What you'll bring




Advanced SQL coding skills
Experience designing, developing, managing and optimising large and diverse databases and datasets, including maintaining and evolving highly complex data transformations and procedures¬†
Advanced experience with financial systems and data analysis and visualisation tools, including SAP, Tableau, Excel, Google Sheets, Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery)
Ability to coach and mentor teams while managing through change and ambiguity.
Proven ability to assess complex investment proposals and develop strategic options that align with long-term business goals.
Exceptional presentation and storyboarding skills, with the ability to simplify complex financial information for a broad audience.
A track record of influencing strategic direction through performance reporting and maintaining strong relationships with senior stakeholders.
CA/CPA qualification with 5‚Äì10 years of post-qualification experience, ideally within the retail or FMCG sectors.




What you‚Äôll experience




Hybrid Flexibility: Blend in-office engagement with work-from-home opportunities for a balanced work week.
A global business with endless career possibilities around every corner and across every discipline ‚Äì with valuable exposure to a vast and exciting business network.
Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work.




Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group




As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best selves, and reach their full potential.




Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team‚Äôs diversity brings to our business, customers, and communities and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems.¬†




Woolworths Group is an inclusive, team-first company and we value all skills and experiences. If you meet some, but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to submit your application.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Forecasting, Pacing & Commercial Modelling
Salary: Highly competitive salary commensurate with exp
Ad Text:
Keypath Education ‚Äì Ranked Best Place to Work in Australia by WRK+ (2021 to 2024)

Keypath Education is a global EdTech company partnering with leading universities to deliver online programs that address real-world social and economic challenges.

Work Anywhere:

At Keypath Education Australia, flexibility is our strength. We put our people first, allowing you to choose where you work ‚Äì from home, in the office, or both. We welcome applications from candidates located anywhere in Australia, provided you have a strong, reliable internet connection.

Please note that only candidates residing in Australia with full working rights will be eligible for consideration.

About the Role

The Senior Analyst, Forecasting, Pacing & Commercial Modelling is Keypath‚Äôs enterprise owner of enrolment forecasting, pacing, and commercial modelling across APAC. You will deliver accurate demand scenarios and financial models that inform workforce planning, pricing, investment decisions, annual budgets, and long-range strategic growth.

This role is highly cross-functional and commercially influential‚Äîshaping decisions across Marketing, Sales, Product, Finance, and Strategy.

Key Accountabilities:

Forecasting Governance and Enrolment Modelling

Own the APAC enrolment forecast across partners and study periods.

Maintain and refine forecasting methodology, assumptions, and scenario architecture.

Lead rolling forecasts, study-period reporting, and variance analysis.

Publish forecast packs and run reviews with Sales, Marketing, and Finance.

Develop the annual enrolment forecast aligned to the FY budget.

Real-Time Pacing and Scenario Modelling

Build automated pacing tools for intra-period performance tracking.

Run scenario modelling for promotions, pricing, channel mix, and capacity.

Translate demand scenarios into commercial, operational, and workforce implications.

Commercial & Financial Modelling for Innovation & Growth

Lead financial modelling for new programs, markets, and delivery models.

Support pricing strategies, ROI assessments, business cases, and margin optimisation.

Maintain long-range planning models aligned to growth and investment priorities.

Convert early-stage concepts into robust, defensible commercial models.

Product Performance & Post-Implementation Review

Monitor performance of newly launched products and programs.

Lead post-implementation reviews comparing outcomes against forecast, ROI, and assumptions.

Cross-Functional Integration

Convert enrolment forecasts into staffing needs with Workforce Planning.

Align modelling assumptions across Sales, Marketing, Product, and Finance.

Partner with Data Engineering to ensure automation and data reliability.

Tooling, Governance & Capability Enablement

Enhance automation and quality control across forecasting and commercial models.

Maintain the Forecast & Modelling Playbook.

Coach leaders on forecast interpretation, pacing metrics, and scenario usage.

Foster a culture of analytical rigour and innovation.

Essential Requirements:

Education

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Analytics, Data Science, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.

Postgraduate qualifications (e.g., Master‚Äôs in Applied Analytics, Finance, or Econometrics) are advantageous but not essential.

Experience

8+ years in forecasting, demand modelling, or financial/commercial analytics.

Proven experience building enterprise forecasting frameworks and scenario models.

Strong background in financial modelling for new products, pricing, markets, and ROI analysis.

Experience developing automated pacing dashboards and intervention models.

Confident communicator capable of influencing senior stakeholders.

Experience partnering with Sales, Product, Marketing, and Finance on forecasts and pacing strategies.

Experience working with Data Engineering on automation and data pipelines.

Education sector experience beneficial but not essential.

PL‚Äë300 Power BI certification advantageous.

Technical

Advanced forecasting, scenario modelling, and financial modelling (Excel essential; Python/R optional).

Strong Power BI capability (dashboards, forecast packs, performance reporting).

SQL proficiency and experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Microsoft Fabric).

Ability to build automated pacing and scenario tools integrated into forecasting frameworks.

Excellent executive-level data storytelling and presentation skills.

High numerical reasoning, structured thinking, and meticulous attention to detail.

Unique Requirements

Ability to work across multiple time zones and business units to support forecast governance, pacing reviews, and cross‚Äëfunctional planning cycles.

Comfortable operating in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment, with shifting demand signals and commercial priorities

Occasional travel may be required.

Additional Information:

Benefits and Rewards:

Opportunity to work in office, hybrid or remote

All the necessary equipment for success.

Internet Allowance for remote work.

Paid Mental Health days for your well-being.

Access to LinkedIn Learning

Learning Labs designed to promote L&D

Toolkits for Digital Health and Mental Health support.

Employee led programs such as Culture Club, Team Green, Sustainability and more

Company events and activities run in office and remotely

Why Keypath?

Embrace Your Authentic Self: A supportive culture recognized as a top workplace (Ranked #6 on 2024 the Best Places to Work Australia¬©).

Global EdTech Leader: Join an industry on the rise.

Continuous Growth: Upskill through discounted study opportunities.

Transform the World: Contribute to upskilling and reskilling globally.

Make an Impact: Help solve future economic and social challenges.

Join Keypath and make a difference. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and offer inclusive support throughout the recruitment process.

Apply now to unlock your potential with Keypath!

Preferred applicants may be required to complete a police check and other pre-employment checks.

Job Title: UKG Integration Lead / Lead Business Analyst
Ad Text:
About the Role

This role supports the functional analysis and delivery of integrations across a complex ST&A and payroll ecosystem, including Workday HCM, UKG (T&A/WFM), Dayforce aPay, Okta, Saviynt, analytics and legacy platforms.

In addition to hands-on analysis, this position will operate in a lead capacity across the integration stream. You will act as the key liaison between business stakeholders, architects, developers, vendors and testing teams, ensuring alignment across requirements, design and delivery.




You will lead workshops, validate integration approaches, oversee data mapping and reconciliation, and support testing, cutover and go-live readiness. A strong focus is ensuring data integrity and cross-system alignment through integration-led data movement.


About You

You are a senior Integration or HR Systems Business Analyst experienced in complex enterprise environments. You are confident facilitating workshops, guiding solution discussions and influencing stakeholders across business and technical teams.

You bring strong integration analysis capability, a structured approach to documentation and testing, and the ability to coordinate across multiple workstreams while driving outcomes.


Key Skills & Experience
Experience leading requirements gathering for system integrations
Strong understanding of HR, payroll, time and attendance and workforce management processes
Hands-on experience with platforms such as Workday, UKG or Dayforce
Experience documenting integration specifications, data mappings and workflows
Strong data analysis and reconciliation capability
Experience supporting integration and end-to-end testing
Strong stakeholder engagement across business, IT and vendors
Nice to Have
Experience with Okta, Saviynt or similar identity platforms
Exposure to integration-led data migration and cutover
Large enterprise or higher education experience
UKG, Workday or Dayforce certifications

This role offers the opportunity to step into a senior, lead-facing position within a significant enterprise transformation program.




Please apply with current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Dylan Tasker on dylan.tasker@davidsonwp.com , quoting reference JN -022026-42382. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

Ad Text:
We are seeking a Senior Enterprise Investment Advisor to lead Coliban Water‚Äôs investment evaluation and cost estimation practices. You will be the authority on business case quality, investment evaluation frameworks, and cost estimation methodologies, ensuring that all investment proposals deliver value for money and align with strategic priorities.¬†

This role¬†provides¬†expert advice to the Executive Leadership Team, Enterprise Investment Committee, and Investment Review Committee, shaping investment decisions with evidence-based insights. You will lead a small team of investment analysts and cost estimators, champion rigorous evaluation practices, and build organisational capability in investment assessment and financial appraisal.¬†

¬†

Key Responsibilities:¬†

As¬†our¬†Senior Enterprise Investment Advisor,¬†you‚Äôll¬†be accountable for:¬†

Lead and continuously improve the Investment Evaluation Framework, cost estimation methods, and business case standards.¬†

Provide¬†authoritative advice on investment evaluation, strategic justification, and value for money.¬†

Oversee Investment Logic Mapping (ILM), multi-criteria analysis (MCA), economic appraisal, and whole-of-life costing.¬†

Ensure business cases are robust, defensible, and aligned with regulatory and organisational priorities.¬†

Coach and develop your team and stakeholders on best practice investment evaluation and cost estimation.¬†

Partner strategically with senior leaders to integrate evaluation outcomes into portfolio prioritisation and enterprise planning.¬†

¬†

About you:¬†

Extensive experience (8‚Äì10 years) in investment evaluation, cost estimation, and business case development.¬†

Strong leadership capability, with experience guiding high-performing analytical teams.¬†

Expert knowledge of ILM, MCA, economic appraisal, cost planning, and whole-of-life costing.¬†

Exceptional communication, stakeholder engagement, and influencing skills at senior executive levels.¬†

Experience in regulated industries, utilities, or infrastructure is highly desirable.¬†

¬†

Sound like¬†you?¬†We‚Äôd¬†love to hear from you.¬†¬†

¬†

Learn more in the position description¬†

¬†

Salary:¬†

The salary and conditions for this position will be as per the Coliban Water Enterprise Agreement 2021¬†Band¬†6¬†$142,905 - $152,323 plus super¬†salary¬†range will be offered to the successful candidate¬†commensurate¬†with their skills and experience.¬†¬†

¬†

Enquiries:¬†

For further information please contact¬†Bidita Rezwana¬†on¬†0431173635¬†or via email at¬†bidita.rezwana@coliban.com.au¬†

To apply, please¬†submit¬†your resume and cover letter by¬†3 March 2026.¬†

¬†

Why join us?¬†

At Coliban Water our people are on a mission to create a better life for our customers and communities ‚Äì now and tomorrow.¬†¬†

We love what we do and our location in the centre of a region that takes in 49 towns from Trentham to Echuca.¬†¬†

Our commitment to inclusion means¬†you‚Äôll¬†feel at home here no matter who you are, who you love, or what you stand for. As part of the¬†team¬†you receive a monthly¬†accrued¬†day off, time off over Christmas, the flexibility to shape your work to suit your lifestyle, and generous parental, carer and workplace study leave policies.¬†¬†

At Coliban Water we balance a small team rhythm with the reach and resources of one of the largest Victorian regional urban water corporations.¬†

¬†

What are you waiting for?¬†We‚Äôd¬†love you to join us.¬†

¬†

Applicants will need to successfully complete all core training requirements in the expected¬†timeframes¬†and may¬†be required¬†to undertake a Police Check, Working with Children Check, Pre-Employment Medicals or Psychometric testing where applicable.¬†Applicants may also¬†be required¬†to produce evidence of their Right to Work in Australia.¬†¬†

We welcome applications from individuals of all abilities. We are committed to creating an accessible and inclusive workplace for everyone, including people with disabilities and diverse abilities. If you need any support during the application process or would like to discuss interview adjustments, please contact Bidita Rezwana.¬†

Please¬†indicate¬†any adjustments (administrative, environmental, or procedural) you may need to effectively¬†participate¬†in the recruitment process and/or carry out the requirements of the role you are applying for.¬†¬†

Please note that applicants may be contacted prior to the closing date. Coliban Water will be unavailable during the Christmas shutdown period from 25 December 2025 to 4 January 2026

What we can do for you

At Specsavers, we know that to reach your full potential you need to work somewhere that will bring¬†out your best. We pride ourselves on offering a workplace with a supportive, driven, flexible and inclusive culture.

In 2025, we were proudly recognised as one of Australia‚Äôs Best Places to Work for the third consecutive year and ranked 12th on Fortune‚Äôs list of the World‚Äôs 25 Best Workplaces. Here‚Äôs a taste of just some of our perks:

Quarterly bonus scheme

Two free pairs of glasses each year

On-site free parking

Birthday, Volunteer, Professional Development and Paid Parental Leave

Health & Wellbeing programs

Fully funded social club ‚Äì provides a wide range of activities throughout the year

So, if you like the sound of working for a company that‚Äôs dedicated to improving the lives of both their people and customers -¬†we think you‚Äôd look good at Specsavers.¬†

The Role & Team


As a Data Engineer within our ANZ Data team, you‚Äôll play a key role in transforming business requirements into practical, data-driven solutions. You‚Äôll be responsible for migrating and shaping data, building views that empower teams across the organisation, and ensuring data is accessible and valuable for decision-making.

In this role, your primary focus will be on data integrity and security. You‚Äôll lead the analysis, design, and development of tools and frameworks that support data transformation, migration, and other critical services. A key part of the role will involve supporting and migrating legacy data systems, which remain essential to our success. By creating repeatable, reliable processes, you‚Äôll ensure our data solutions are robust, scalable, and aligned with business needs‚Äîmaking you an essential part of delivering high-quality outcomes.


What we are looking for:

You have extensive experience as a Data Engineer, with proven hands-on expertise in Azure Databricks, including advanced use of SQL and Python for data transformation and migration (essential).

Proven ability to build strong cross-departmental relationships across the ANZ region, while leveraging business insight and technical expertise to provide strategic advice and deliver improved outcomes (essential)

Strong technical ability with a solid understanding of big data platforms and their architecture. Proficient in data development tools and ETL processes.

Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to explain technical and business processes in clear, simple language to stakeholders at all levels

Relevant certifications in Azure Databricks or Azure Data Engineering is preferred

About Us

Specsavers are rated the market leader for eye tests, the retailer of choice for contact lenses and one of the fastest growing hearing providers in Australia and New Zealand. We are on a continual mission to transform eye and hearing health by eliminating preventable vision loss and blindness, including Glaucoma and Diabetes, through improved prevention and early detection, as well as providing accessible and affordable hearing care.

At Specsavers we believe a diverse, inclusive, and flexible culture enables our people to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. When it comes to flexibility, we understand that one size doesn't fit all. Our flexible working at Specsavers enables us to work in ways that support our lifestyle to help us balance our career with the other important things in life.

Creating a great place to work for our people is pinnacle to us and along with our Behaviours is at the core of everything we do. We like to think it‚Äôs a fun and positive place to work ‚Äì why not have a look for yourself https://join.specsavers.com/au/department/support-office/

Thanks to everyone who has applied previously ‚Äî you don‚Äôt need to submit another application.

Will you actively create a healthier future for tomorrow?

‚ÄØ

At Medibank we're encouraged to think big. We have a clear purpose to impact better health outcomes for our customers, patients and our community.

‚ÄØ

We celebrate diversity of thought because we want to make better decisions for our customers. As we work towards our goal of better health for better lives, we value the knowledge and contribution of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders. We are working hard to create an inclusive workplace and develop Indigenous careers.

Medibank has bold 2030 Vision to deliver the best health and wellbeing for Australia increasingly relies on succeeding in Digital. Digital platforms and engineering services will be a critical‚ÄØenabler for future health and insurance experiences we deliver to our customers. The current Digital platforms‚ÄØhave strong capabilities but for us to win in the context of 2030 vision, our digital assets will need to be‚ÄØreimagined and further evolved that is scalable, increases agility and accelerate solution delivery with‚ÄØimproved security posture.‚ÄØ

We're looking for an experienced Agile Digital Business Analyst to join our Health Orchestration & Navigation squad. This role supports a BA stepping into an extended opportunity, and we need someone who can hit the ground running. This is an initial 6-moth contract with a day rate of $900 including super.Our squad is focused on building and evolving a digitally connected health ecosystem‚Äîsupporting customers with personalised, meaningful health experiences across a wide range of programs and offerings.If you're a proactive BA who thrives in Agile product environments and loves shaping meaningful digital solutions, we'd love to hear from you.
What You'll Do
Support the Product Owner with discovery and sprint‚Äëahead activities.
Define problems, outcomes, and delivery‚Äëready requirements for upcoming sprints.
Lead backlog refinement and sprint‚Äëahead sessions.
Ensure engineers, designers, and testers share a consistent understanding of requirements.
Help shape and improve the squad's discovery and delivery processes.
Maintain requirement traceability and ensure documentation stays up to date.
Act as the link between stakeholders and the squad to validate business intent and ensure value delivery.

Must‚ÄëHave Skills
Strong communication skills across teams, vendors, partners, and senior leaders.
Ability to work independently and proactively drive clarity and decision‚Äëmaking.
Fast learner capable of ramping up quickly.
Collaborative working style in cross‚Äëfunctional squads.
High attention to detail.

We currently have an opportunity for a Data Manager in Canberra or Melbourne to work on Land projects.


Join our Downer Professional Services team and play a key role in delivering complex defence and national security projects that safeguard Australia's future.



Downer Professional Services comprises of three business units our Technical, Advisory, and Capability consulting practice, and Team Downer, which partners with CASG and NSSG as a major service provider to Defence. Together, we are a multi-disciplinary advisory and delivery partner of choice for clients across Defence and National Security.



We currently have an opportunity for a Data Manager in Canberra or Melbourne to work on Land projects.



What You'll Do


This role offers a broad scope, with key role responsibilities including:




Data & Information Management: Develop, maintain, and improve processes for storing, sharing, and managing project data using Defence systems (Objective, SharePoint, DOORS, Teams).





Quality & Compliance: Support Project Quality Management Systems (QMS) and ensure compliance with ISO 9001:2015 standards.





Technical Support & Training: Provide assistance and training to project personnel on applications, online systems, and data management practices.





Governance & Reporting: Prepare briefs, reports, and submissions for governance forums, while coordinating project and contract meetings.





Stakeholder & Procurement Engagement: Collaborate with Defence, industry, and contractors to manage procurement activities, evaluate responses, and build effective stakeholder relationships.



What You'll Bring





Data Management Expertise: Demonstrated experience as a Data Manager (or similar) on complex, highly technical Defence capability projects.





Quality & Compliance Knowledge: Strong understanding of Defence Quality Management Systems (QMS) and ISO 9001 standards.





Systems & Tools Proficiency: High-level experience with Defence information and records management systems such as Objective, SharePoint, DOORS, and Predict.





Workflow & Documentation Control: Proven ability to develop and manage document workflows, ensuring version control and chain of custody.





Stakeholder & Communication Skills: Effective collaboration in complex stakeholder environments, with advanced technical writing and strong verbal communication skills.




Due to the nature of the work, you are required to currently hold and maintain a minimum Negative Vetting 1 or higher Security clearance as required by the Commonwealth. In some instances, compliance with International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements may also be an inherent requirement.


More than anything, you'll bring a strong work ethic, a positive attitude, and a commitment to delivering high-quality outcomes for our clients.



Why Downer Professional Services


At Downer Professional Services, we're not just a workplace - we're a business dedicated to contributing to the shaping of the future of defence in Australia. As the country's only sovereign prime, we're committed to making a real difference in protecting Australia's interests.



What is means to belong at Downer Professional Services








Meaningful work: Help to deliver critical Defence projects that protect Australia and shape its future.



Professional development: Access career mapping, accelerated learning programs, and shared learning through our Communities of Practice.



Great perks: Enjoy discounts on healthcare, retail, vehicles, and more through Perks@Downer.



Veteran support: Benefit from initiatives like up to 20 days of Reservist Leave to stay connected post-service.



You want your work to matter and so do we. With over 26,000 people across Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific, our team is made up of individuals with unique perspectives, backgrounds, and ideas.

We know that diversity makes us stronger and we actively celebrate it through our commitment to inclusion and belonging.



We're committed to building a team that reflects the diverse communities we serve and we welcome people of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, cultures, abilities, and lived experiences. We especially encourage applications from those whose voices have traditionally been underrepresented in our industry, including women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, MƒÅori and Pasifika Peoples, veterans, people with disability, and neurodivergent individuals. Aurelia Metals Limited is an ASX-listed, Australian-owned gold and base metals company based in NSW. We operate the Peak and Federation underground mines and are progressing the Great Cobar Project, a high-grade copper development near Peak.

We are proud to be a WORK180 endorsed employer, with inclusion, safety, and our Values at the heart of everything we do. With one of the most prospective land positions in the Cobar Basin, we are unlocking value through discovery, development, and growth.

The Great Cobar Project, with an eight-year mine plan and strong exploration upside, will drive the next generation of growth at Aurelia and create diverse career pathways for those wanting to be part of a high-performance, forward-thinking culture.




About the role¬†

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Financial Planning and Analysis Manager to join our team. Reporting directly to the Chief Financial Officer, this is a highly visible role where you will act as a trusted advisor, bringing clarity, insight, and thoughtful challenge to support strategic decision-making across the business.

In this role, you will manage the FP&A function, providing high-quality financial and economic insights that support business planning, growth initiatives, and key projects across the Company. While the role has no direct reports, you will lead through influence, partnering closely with leaders and the executive team to drive alignment and deliver meaningful outcomes.

You are someone who brings both strong technical capability and a collaborative approach, with the ability to translate complex financial information into clear, practical insights. Your experience in financial planning and analysis, ideally within the resources sector, will enable you to provide accurate and timely guidance that supports confident decision-making.

With a naturally engaging communication style and strong commercial awareness, you build trusted relationships across all levels of the organisation. You are comfortable balancing strategic thinking with hands-on delivery and thrive in an environment where you can make a genuine impact.

¬†

Roster: Monday to Friday (travel to site required)

Location:¬†Brisbane CBD




Key responsibilities¬†

Lead the Group planning cycle, including life of mine plans, annual budgets, and forecasts

Develop and maintain robust Life of Mine Plan models, supporting sites with their own models

Consolidate operational submissions and present outcomes to the leadership team and Board

Conduct detailed analysis and scenario modelling on group performance, cash flow, and commodity price sensitivities

Manage the Group planning system (Workday Adaptive), including ongoing development and enhancements

Coordinate risk assessments at each stage of the planning cycle

Oversee capital governance, including approval processes and intra-year forecasts

Deliver financial analysis (variance, trends, benchmarking) to support reporting and cost-saving opportunities

Manage the group cash flow model and provide regular updates to leadership, Board, and financiers

Provide financial modelling and analysis for ad hoc projects, supporting Technical Services and Growth teams

Support major contract tenders through financial evaluation

Monitor external analyst coverage and identify opportunities to align market forecasts with Aurelia‚Äôs messaging




Qualifications and experience

Tertiary qualification in business, finance, or a mining-related discipline

Proven experience in corporate planning, financial modelling, and investment analysis within complex environments

Strong understanding of mining processes and value chain interdependencies

Advanced Excel and financial modelling skills

Familiarity with Power BI, QlikView, or Workday Adaptive (desirable)
